body_html:
Thanks for the PR. A few things from API review:

  • The UniqueV2 operation takes an int64 axis. It should take an int32 consistent with other operations that take an axis argument. It should be fine to change UniqueV2 in place since there are no users of it. (And then we'll have to wait another 3 weeks for the Python change)

  • Documentation of the UniqueV2 op in C++ seems incorrect (for example, starts with "1-D tensor " :)

  • Update the documentation for tf.unique to include examples with the axis argument.
body_text:
Thanks for the PR. A few things from API review:


The UniqueV2 operation takes an int64 axis. It should take an int32 consistent with other operations that take an axis argument. It should be fine to change UniqueV2 in place since there are no users of it. (And then we'll have to wait another 3 weeks for the Python change)


Documentation of the UniqueV2 op in C++ seems incorrect (for example, starts with "1-D tensor " :)


Update the documentation for tf.unique to include examples with the axis argument.
body:
Thanks for the PR. A few things from API review:

- The `UniqueV2` operation takes an `int64` axis. It should take an `int32` consistent with other operations that take an axis argument. It should be fine to change `UniqueV2` in place since there are no users of it. (And then we'll have to wait another 3 weeks for the Python change)

- Documentation of the `UniqueV2` op in C++ seems incorrect (for example, starts with "1-D tensor " :)

- Update the documentation for `tf.unique` to include examples with the `axis` argument.
